f6_assessments.q0:
With this proposal, the focus is about bringing  a massive change in Gamified education and learning to make education affordable to connect with real world use cases. Simply, the proposer wants to disrupt the traditional education system. 
With the impact of this proposal, Konma wants to break education boredom by the introduction of new technologies across education, trading, etc. for every individual to upskill while playing; educating community members while they get rewards in various ways across eCommerce stores, jobs, etc; a gamified learning management system. 
In addressing the challenge, Konma Upskill addresses educationin general with regard to educating users across the globe and increasing awareness of the importance of getting upskill through a gamified learning management system. 
The stated risks are in development(small terms), user retention, incentivizing, and credibility. The proposer provided a solution to these challenges such as building a platform for users to grow relationships among themselves for better collaboration, seeking continuous advice from Cardano community, and opportunities to users, among others. In my opinion, the challenge is effectively addressed. My rating is 4.

The budget breakdown is understandable stating amounts allocated to Game design, webpage development, coding and marketing. The overall budget total amount is USD 35,00 which is quite reasonable.

The proposers are already at a stage of gathering virtual space for the community and taking a step by step  approach to gradually gamify their entire Konma Syatem for all DAOs.

f6_assessments.q0: The concept of bringing education and games together is surely gonna catch quite a lot of users' attention. A lot of proposal plan to engage users in pure gaming scenarios and a lot of proposals in the other challenges tries to bring a lot of educational content onto the chain through the traditional approach, which could end up boring a lot of people. This proposal, however, plans to mix them both by picking the exciting essences from them. Involving the users through hackathons, quizzes, games and binding them attractive incentives like tokens will surely draw a lot of "nerd" gamers onboard and also help Cardano's gamer community a lot more diverse and powerful. Konma also mentions having an existing 2-D multiverse platform to keep the users engaged and plans to involve a lot of institutions which can draw a lot of young minds into the ecosystem thus triggering a lot of future contributions. The team is also aware of the possible hurdles they might have to cross during their quest and also have reliable solutions for them.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has submitted several proposals during the previous rounds and they keep coming back with newer ideas and that tremendous and ed-tech has been the core of their plans. The team with their brief introduction has the necessary experience and expertise to make this proposal a reality. The community is provided with an elaborate monthly plan and the proposal being only the phase-1 of their journey shows the team's intent to come back in the next rounds with evidence to raise more funds. The milestones set by the team have been carefully crafted and are not overemphasized like a few other proposals in this challenge. Although the funds requested looks very practical, there is no detailed description of the breakdown of the same, and considering the immense amount of work involved in the project, I feel the team might need a few more hands to help them out apart from the 3 members introduced in the proposal. Hence, that might be an area of concern for me as a reader and score 4 out of 5 for the above reasons.
f6_assessments.q2: Konma has been a name that's been around previous funding rounds and they have been appreciated many times prior and I feel the team would make sure the audit process is effortless in every way possible. The team makes a brief promise about them making timelines and milestones that adhere to the challenge's requisites. However, the team makes no mention of valid KPIs to assist the community in the audit process. There is no evident way to make sure that the progress is well within the expectations of the challenge. A few metrics upfront that the auditors could look forward to would have done a great deal for the proposal. However, the success metrics and the final goals the team intends to achieve look promising and impactful. The one-stop platform of all kinds of learning and cross-chain attribute is surely something to look forward to. The project being an entirely new one, a little more sustainable metrics would had tipped the scale in their favor.
